text: Hans Klodt (10 June 1914 – 7 November 1996) was a German football player. He was the older brother of Bernhard Klodt. He was born in Gelsenkirchen., == Club career == Like his brother, he played for FC Schalke 04 where between 1936 and 1948 he stood in goal. In 1937 he won the German Bundesliga as well as the Tschammer Cup. In 1942 and 1943, he was replaced by Heinz Flotho due to a war injury, and thus missed winning the championship in 1942. His career began not at Schalke 04 but at BV Gelsenkirchen. In 1948, he left Schalke for Beckum, where he played until 1955. == International career == Between 1938 and 1941 he made a total of 17 appearances for the German national team. ==References== ==External links== * * Category:1914 births Category:1996 deaths Category:German footballers Category:FC Schalke 04 players Category:Association football goalkeepers Category:Germany international footballers
title: Hans Klodt
